title: Technology-Based Educational Reform and Critical Case Analysis: Application to Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Parallel implementation of mathematics problem-solving activities using digital devices (tablets/laptops) and online/offline discussion sessions

learning_goals: Learners can critically analyze the strengths and limitations of technology-based mathematics education tools.
Learners can derive educational improvement strategies by comparing real-world technology adoption cases in school settings (Australia, Singapore).
Learners can design and demonstrate creative mathematical problem-solving strategies in digital environments (e.g., GeoGebra, Desmos).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
